intro: Hippocratea longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed hippocratea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, bean-like pods that contain its seeds. Hippocratea longipes is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
